title: Search icon does nothing on Chats screen
body:
[comment]: # (Please replace ... with your information. Remove < and >)

### User Story

As a user, I want to search in chats so that I can find my previous conversations that contain a "search term". If feature is not yet implemented for Chats screen then the icon should be disabled or not visible

### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: Bug

[comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below)
*Summary*: If tap on Search icon on Discover or on Contacts screen then search field is shown, so user can type the search term. On Chats screen if tap on Search icon then nothing happens

#### Expected behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
Search field is shown and user can type in it. 
Or
If feature is not yet implemented for Chats screen then the icon should be disabled or not visible

#### Actual behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what actually happened.)
Nothing happens
### Reproduction
[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Open Status
- Open Chats screen
- Tap on Search icon in the top right corner

### Solution
[comment]: # (Please summarise the solution and provide a task list on what needs to be fixed.)
*Summary*: 

- [ ] Fix it


### Additional Information
[comment]: # (Please do your best to fill this out.)
* Status version: 0.9.3
* Operating System: Android and iOS
* Instabug: https://dashboard.instabug.com/applications/status/beta/bugs/105

#### Logs
Log from Instabug issue:

[comment]: # (if on Android please replicate bug whilst running adb logcat)

Hi @annadanchenko! PR #843, which will possibly be merged for 0.9.5, implements the search, however it only searches by name, not by the chat content.
Should it be changed to also search by previous conversations content?
@GustavoNunes, let's implement search by conversations content later.
@GustavoNunes I might want to much for the beginning, search by name is also fine
